## PolyAsyncIterable.sort() method

Return an iteration of the elements of `this` sorted according to `func`

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
sort(func?: Comparator<T>): PolyAsyncIterable<T>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  func | [Comparator](./polyethylene.comparator.md)<!-- -->&lt;T&gt; | <i>(Optional)</i> A comparator function |

<b>Returns:</b>

PolyAsyncIterable&lt;T&gt;

A new [PolyAsyncIterable](./polyethylene.polyasynciterable.md) that yields the elements of `this` sorted according to `func`

## Remarks

The sort function `func` is used to call  on an array of all the elements. However, the default comparator function will sort elements according to the `<` and `>` operators defined on their own type, of always sorting lexicagraphically like  does.

This method will buffer \_all\_ elements of the iteration, and yield them all at once at the end
